entry.title: Thanks for sharing this one. From a Tolstoy st...
entry.content:
Thanks for sharing this one.
From a Tolstoy story:
the most important time is now, the most important person is the one you are with, and the most important action is to do that person good.

Where was I? Tempe, Arizona: my children sleeping as I watched Monday Night Football alone, my future ex-wife 3000 miles away. Thirty years - like that.

entry.title: Luis, Thank you for being alive; for having the br...
entry.content:
Luis,
Thank you for being alive; for having the bravery and grit in your mouth to tell it like it is. I remember nothing about John Lennon dying, but when I read your story I was reminded of my story of poverty. This is a priceless gift.
You are a true artist.
Con Cario,
Cynthia

entry.title: Blessing for all you did, do, and are still to do....
entry.content:
Blessing for all you did, do, and are still to do.
I wrote this for Johns birthday.

For Taylor Mali in the land of Gandhi

World Peace Interrupted
By Charles Redner

Imagine a poem that pursues world peace.
RING. RING.
Thanksgiving dinner sans arguments.
A school playground without a scuffle.
Civility returns to the U.S. Congress.

Imagine a poem that elevates world peace.
RING. RING.
Rappers remove F-bombs from their lyrics.
Folsom Prison skinheads play music on the bars.
Mississippi clansmen burn hand-me-down sheets.

Imagine a poem that promotes world peace.
RING. RING.
Machetes melted for dinner plates in Sudan.
Fights in Thailand are over Pad Thai or Woonsen.
Tanks backup in North Korea.

Imagine a poem that advances world peace.
RING. RING.
Cartel guns in Mexico go silent.
Harmony settles over Palestine.
War no more in Afghanistan.

Imagine a poem that encourages world peace.
RING. RING.
The spirit of Gandhi spreads throughout Pakistan.
Bomb-makers in Karachi bake honey cakes instead.
Al Qaeda begs forgiveness before disbanding.

Im writing a poem to establish world peace.
RING. RING. RING. RING.
Hello.
Lennon would have turned seventy today. Imagine.
I already have.

entry.title:
Luis,
Thanks for starting my day off with a huge ...
entry.content:
Luis,

Thanks for starting my day off with a huge smile! Loved the signage: "Sod the Dog, Beware of the Kids." And I've always loved "Solsbury Hill" but didn't know it was an actual place and certainly didn't know it's about Gabriel's decision to quit Genesis. So much poetry and beauty packed into this--how do you make it all look so effortless?
cheers,
may

entry.title: Thanks for the ride. I see it, and you, and you&#3...
entry.content:
Thanks for the ride. I see it, and you, and you're both wonderful to observe. I get it:

"When you're a kid, you think
you already know. You think you'll be back
1,000,000 times. Why look?"

Exactly. Precisely. They say children see everything as if for the first time... but if you work it right, it becomes truer for adults. Or maybe we see everything as if for the last time. Is that more mindful?

Sorry about your molar.

Practice makes perfect.

entry.title: Duane sounds like the Michelangelo of cursing. The...
entry.content: Duane sounds like the Michelangelo of cursing. The delicious low point here is the disgusting image of the dessicated Kentucky Fried Chicken box, which, as we all know, would still have crumbs and grease clinging to it, no matter how much one tried to lick it clean, or how long it sat drying out. Comparing someone to such a foul remnant is an exquisite insult, indeed.

entry.title: Beautiful. Sad that some will *never* comprehend w...
entry.content: Beautiful. Sad that some will *never* comprehend what you have said. Ironic that Richard of Cambridge thinks he sees, but misses entirely the point of the poem. Which in itself, sort of *is* the point of the poem...

entry.title: I see SB1070 as a reaction being like what happene...
entry.content:
I see SB1070 as a reaction being like what happened the community that I was born in which at the time had doors left unlocked and cars parked with keys in the ignition. Then all of a sudden break ins exploded and car theft. The change was sad abnd it took some getting used to as people trust disappeared and things got worse. Realistically however the people had to first lock doors then build grills over windows and take their keys after locking their cars. The people who acted improperly by robbing houses and cars motivated a change towards undfriendliness and distrust that was sad but without the self protection by the islanders things would be even worse.

Richard Bond
Cambridge, Ma
St. Croix USVI

entry.title: Reading this poem I think of my grandmother, who g...
entry.content:
Reading this poem I think of my grandmother, who grew up in a cold water flat in the Bronx. It reminds me of the time she told me that she went to public school for one day and never returned. She was too poor to buy a new dress, and she felt tremendous shame for not having fresh clean clothes. Of course, she was stared at and singled out for being dirty.

As always, Luis, it is an honor to be able to read and comment on your work. This poem makes a powerful statement. I hope it will be read far and wide.

Kathryn

entry.title: As a result of the new highway from Durango to Maz...
entry.content:
As a result of the new highway from Durango to Mazatlan passing very close to Rosario there is likely to be an upswing in tourism. Rosario with the municipal and insitutional buildings and large old houses built by the mining tycoons is likely to not be a backwater for long. Your book and the expected movie is likely to accelerate the process.

Richard Bond
Cambridge, Ma
St. Croix, USVI

entry.title: Sr. Luis, always good to hear about Rudy. Delighte...
entry.content: Sr. Luis, always good to hear about Rudy. Delighted that he honored you with his presence. He did take care of us all in one way or another. His footprints are deep in the stone here in the Southwest. I even got to show up in one of the Sonny Baca novels when the vato showed up in El Paso on the trail of murder and mayhem. He's been good to me personally, and he's been good to Cinco Puntos. He was always surprised that a publishing company could make it in El Paso. And now we're here 25 years. Thanks to folks like Rudy, folks like you. Abrazos a todos.

entry.title:
"The personal IS the political."
You l...
entry.content:
"The personal IS the political."

You listened and learned that one well, eh?

Now we're listening to you.

I'm sure he's pleased how some of his fire got passed on to you. You honor him well, both in how you write about Saint Rudy - and in how you embody his teaching. Ya done him proud, I'm sure.

entry.title:
Luis-
Congratulations... again! Like another one...
entry.content:
Luis-

Congratulations... again! Like another one of your fans said, you do deserve "every bit of praise." It was great to see you acknowledge Rudolfo Anaya for the inspiration he provided you and the love he has given all. The community I live in recently used Anaya's Bless Me, Ultima for our community-wide Big Read and I was thrilled to have a chance to actually speak to the living-legend myself. Now through email, I have a chance to speak to another. Thank you so much for all of your literary contributions. I absolutely adore you and got very excited recently to hear you will be coming about 100 miles north of where I live to Sacramento. Yahoo! I missed you in Berkeley. I'm not letting it happen again. I'm definitely going to make you sign my cherished copy of that crappy book Hummingbird's Daughter!

With abiding affection,
Michelle

entry.title: Art-light. Yes. I know it well. Have glowed in its...
entry.content: Art-light. Yes. I know it well. Have glowed in its aftermath many times. Thank you for giving it words.

entry.title: Thanks for sharing this. From top to bottom, don&#...
entry.content:
Thanks for sharing this. From top to bottom, don't we writers often move through a luminous world full of illuminating people? On the other hand, I'll be laughing about the Hummingbird Hater for a long time to come. "Your book sucks, but will you help me get mine published?" Hilarious!

BTW - Hummingbird's Daughter is one of the few novels I've read that I consider perfect. So there, Ms. H.H.

entry.title: Thanks for the writing, your love shines through y...
entry.content: Thanks for the writing, your love shines through your work. Bless Me Ultima, all those writers that got published early on were such a blessing to me. To have a voice that sounded like my family was so wonderful. Thanks to Mr Anaya and thanks to you Luis for respecting and loving your ancestors.

entry.title: Feeling so blessed. Thanks for sharing.
entry.content: Feeling so blessed. Thanks for sharing.

entry.title: I have a feeling this is one of those events that&...
entry.content: I have a feeling this is one of those events that's going to be seeping into you over time - you as part of that fabric. This is your herencia - and I can attest first-hand how you have shared that with the same spirit of generosity that has been offered to you. In the book of my herencia, both you and Rudolfo Anaya are written into the same chapter. Thanks for taking us for the ride - taking me back to NM for a night. Hope all the good of it stays with you a long time - well, at least till you return. How cool is that?! Makes me smile for ya.

entry.title: I taught Bless Me for several years at Hilltop Hig...
entry.content:
I taught Bless Me for several years at Hilltop High School in Chulajuana, CA. 9th Grade English. The kids liked it as long as they didn't have too many god-help-us essays ("Another chingadera essay, ese?")
When they were seniors I had some of them again and made them read "Across the Wire". Now that one they loved. All the glue-sniffing and blood-specked feces just spoke to their bordertown hearts. Congrats on your enshrinement, dude. Look for a package coming your way soon (and fear not the reaper) . . .

entry.title: Nice. And congratulations. You deserve every award...
entry.content: Nice. And congratulations. You deserve every award, every good review, every bit of praise.

entry.title: Beautiful!
entry.content: Beautiful!

entry.title: The bleedings hearts are blooming in our very bodi...
entry.content:
The bleedings hearts
are blooming
in our very bodies.

This season has brought such changes!

I look forward to our next meeting, may there be homemade bread and enough time.

entry.title:
Absolutely!
We've got 5 of those maples. One...
entry.content:
Absolutely!

We've got 5 of those maples. One spring when we were gone for a weekend all the seeds came down at once. Then nine inches of rain. We came home to an inch of water in the basement (we're on high, dry sandy spot) because the seeds plugged the gutters.

HBDII chapters. Food for this soul.

The loss of a poet and friend holds much reflection. A red bleeding heart dedicated to Rane will be perfect. You and Mrs. U can toast him with your tea.

Peace,
Cathy

entry.title: Seems Im missing the planting gene, but I love al...
entry.content: Seems Im missing the planting gene, but I love all things growing. At my Tucson place, am always getting a note from the HOA that the weeds are high in your yard. Coming from New Jersey, anything growing in Arizona became sacred to me. Now in Laguna, I have been transplanted into a garden that might challenge Eden. Sorry you lost a friend, Luis, hope the digging/planting helps dull the pain. --Charlie

entry.title: Luis, Columbines are quite prolific aren't the...
entry.content:
Luis,
Columbines are quite prolific aren't they? Let them go to seed, and babies everywhere!
What color of columbines do you have? I love the traditional blue/purple columbines, but mine are the multi colored giant variety (they came with the house). I like how they have prospered though. Right now they are a multitude of green fans (leaves) filling in the spaces between the tulips and wayward grass.

Mariah

entry.title: Hi Luis, Ah, I knew I liked Thomas More. Bread do...
entry.content:
Hi Luis,
Ah, I knew I liked Thomas More. Bread dough and gardening - I like the connection - both are gifts of the hand. And I think each, in their own way, pay back a certain respect to the Maker and our place on earth.

Each year, I am re-amazed at the expanding number of latter-day offshoots of perennials originally planted by my grandparents at their earliest home in Chicago. Cuttings have been planted at my parents' homes and more have traveled with us to each house we have lived in. There are purple flowered sedum and hostas, ferns, peonies, and a few irises.
To those we've added lambs ear, daisies, daylillies, and more. We had a mass of columbines, but they were overgrown by enthusiastic ribbon grass bought at a U of I mother's weekend plant sale. Wanna' swap hostas and ribbon grass for columbines?
Roxanne

entry.title: Nothing like 'the ground' to ground one. [...
entry.content:
Nothing like 'the ground' to ground one. [I take that concept very literally.] Digging, planting, planting ones own butt down, yer back leaning against the trunk of King Ralph or Queen Sally: ahhhhh... Dirty fingernails and poetic stones that find their way into your pockets to be found later -- these are the things that ground us -- along with the love.

We're still HERE on this blue marble whirling through space. Nice to be sharing it with you. My condolences with your loss. Let your tears water the columbines and bleeding hearts.
xo

entry.title: Luis, Isn't it great how these little (or big)...
entry.content:
Luis,
Isn't it great how these little (or big) plants insinuate themselves into our souls becoming colorful markers for rich experiences and remembered places? I love all the flora I have planted in our yardscape -- even if not professionally installed or perfectly located.
In an odd way, it's better for me to have these blooms show up haphazardly in riots and fits and starts. I like it that way. Not too planned out, but if one looks really closely you can see an underlying reasonableness.
Caring for the soul...oh, my friend, what a task that is. I think I know dozens of soul-starved people who go around in desperate consumption looking to feed the soul.
It's kinda scary to do it right. Often times feeding the soul means taking the monkey-mind out of the driver's seat for a bit so I can take a dip in deeper water. There I can swim in a rainbow and climb the mountains in the sea. I can play checkers with a dolphin while the mockingbirds sing.
In this place the bleeding hearts bloom alongside the columbines, a glorious symphony tuned to the color of my eye.
Yes, get your hands dirty and sing a song. Make it a prayer for the soul needs its voice.
I am singing a prayer for you, dear mentor (I'm borrowing that one from Jackie, because I love it); for your soul to keep shining into your lovely works, for the passage of your dear friend, for the well-being of your sweet family, for all good things.
Thank you, Luis!<3
Aho!
Blessed Be!
Cassandra

entry.title: SHAWN PHILLIPS?? As in "Second Contribution,&...
entry.content:
SHAWN PHILLIPS?? As in "Second Contribution," THAT Shawn Phillips? Holy cow, I've listed to that more in my life than to any other album that I own, and he's in your KITCHEN?? I am SO jealous.

And I'm dreaming of your new Hummingbird book, drumming my fingers and dreaming of it...

Robin in Colorado

entry.title: "I CANNOT BELIEVE THIS STUFF HAPPENS TO ME.&q...
entry.content:
"I CANNOT BELIEVE THIS STUFF HAPPENS TO ME."

I do. Your heart is that big, bro.

Reference much of Matthew 6...

You have given much to many, L. God knows what you've done and what is truly in your heart! Since all good things come from Him, He must be pleased!

It is a blessing to know you, and I am glad for every accolade you receive! May they continue to pour in!

Warrior

entry.title: I believe it.
entry.content: I believe it.

entry.title: Hey Luis, Welcome back -- and thanks for the ride ...
entry.content:
Hey Luis, Welcome back -- and thanks for the ride letting us look over your shoulder. Congrats and keep hangin' ten as well as you do. It ain't the size of the wave, it's how you hang -- and the view -- and the cool surfer-dude clothes.

Much happiness for you.

entry.title: Congratulations on all the good things happening t...
entry.content: Congratulations on all the good things happening to you. Wish you many more.

Isn't it amazing that such a year as yo...

Luis,

Isn't it amazing that such a year as you are having is at all possible.

All you have to do is keep writing from the heart.

Tell Shawn to drive safely and bid godspeed...he has an appointment with me in September here in the Bay Area.

Eag

entry.title: Life is all about balance my friend. Sometimes you...
entry.content: Life is all about balance my friend. Sometimes you "kill" it and other times, it kills you and well,that's reality. Having the intention to get back to a healthy routine is half the battle. Actually DOING it is the other half. You did it, it's good and your book is turned in. I'd say a stellar week!
